title: 104_hr3278
content: The conveyance of Saint Helena Island Light Station is discussed in Section 1. The Secretary of Transportation will convey the Saint Helena Island Light Station property to the Great Lakes Lighthouse Keepers Association without payment, subject to appropriate terms and conditions. The conveyance of the Saint Helena Island Light Station property to the Great Lakes Lighthouse Keepers Association is subject to conditions ensuring its use for maritime history interpretation and Coast Guard navigation aid, with reversion to the United States if these conditions are not met. The conveyance of property under the National Historic Preservation Act includes conditions for maintaining navigation functions, such as operating and maintaining active aids to navigation by the United States and prohibiting interference without permission from the Great Lakes Lighthouse Keepers Association. The United States reserves the right to relocate, replace, or add navigation aids at the Saint Helena Island Light Station. They have the right to access the property for maintenance purposes, with an easement for maintaining navigational aids. The station will revert to the United States after 30 days. The Saint Helena Island Light Station will revert to the United States after 30 days if needed for national security purposes. The Great Lakes Lighthouse Keepers Association must maintain the property according to preservation laws. The Saint Helena Island Light Station, located in Mackinac County, Michigan, will not have active aid to navigation equipment maintained by the Keepers Association. The property includes Coast Guard property and improvements but excludes historical artifacts like lenses or lanterns.
